attachments.fallback: <https://twitter.com/tunguz|@tunguz>: <https://twitter.com/blelbach|@blelbach> Well, considering what you were arguing against ... not in the least.
attachments.text: <https://twitter.com/blelbach|@blelbach> Well, considering what you were arguing against ... not in the least.

text: Sounds pretty closed minded and  I don't think he was going to use Julia anyway.

elements.text: Sounds pretty closed minded and  I don't think he was going to use Julia anyway.

text: But yes I think in general I'm done with Julia evangelism. What kinda gets  me is that people have an idea of what makes Go, Rust and swift special, but folk  Julia lore is filled misconceptions, like just a fast python + matlab

elements.text: But yes I think in general I'm done with Julia evangelism. What kinda gets  me is that people have an idea of what makes Go, Rust and swift special, but folk  Julia lore is filled misconceptions, like just a fast python + matlab

text: I don't disagree, but there are cases where it isn't really useful engaging this kind of discussion

elements.text: I don't disagree, but there are cases where it isn't really useful engaging this kind of discussion

text: Also, one problem is that even if you convince an unwilling person to try Julia, they'll easily find lots of issue to confirm their prejudice without looking at the merits. Reinforcing their bias is not going to have a good effect
